726917f-a.title: Queens: Hoyt Avenue - 24th Street
726917f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, north side, between 24th and Crescent Streets, showint the back yards of homes fronting on 24th (left) and Crescent Streets. Some of these will be torn down to make way for the construction of the Triborough Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  May 27, 1934

726911f-b.title: Queens: Hoyt Avenue - 24th Street
726911f-b.text:
Hoyt Avenue, east from and across 21st Street, showing the course of the Triborough Bridge. Whatever buildings stood in line of the bridge were raned. Note the old farmhouse on the right. It was part of the S.J. Hallett property
in 1873.
Views 2 and 3 are east from 23rd and 24th Streets respectively. The Triborough Bridge is on the left.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: August 3, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS  Views 2,3 1936
